title.narrative: Provide life-saving shelter/NFI assistance and protection services to families displaced by conflict in Marib and Al Jawf

description.narrative:
UNHCR will lead urgent interventions to improve the living conditions of 204,000 displaced Yemenis in Marib and 53,000 displaced Yemenis in Al Jawf, affected by the recent conflict escalation.
Through protection interventions, UNHCR will conduct vulnerability assessments as basis for referrals to protection services, operate a community center from which legal assistance, psychosocial support (PSS), child protection and GBV services will be delivered; and provide emergency cash assistance to highly vulnerable displaced persons with specific and urgent needs not covered by the broader multi-purpose cash assistance in Marib governorate.
In Al-Jawf, UNHCR will implement five quick impact projects in the informal IDP hosting sites with the largest population concentration. The projects will promote social cohesion, contribute to address GBV risks faced by women and girls while accessing hygiene facilities (segregated latrines for women) and improve the accessibility on the sites for persons with disabilities, older persons and pregnant women. The QIPs proposed by UNHCR are focused on enhancing social cohesion among the host community and IDPs while also addressing major critical protection risks.
With respect to shelter, UNHCR will assist the most vulnerable displaced families in Marib, in urgent need of help to pay their rent and avoid imminent eviction with rental subsidy assistance. Through the procurement and distribution of emergency shelters and NFI kits, UNHCR will support a swift response to families newly displaced in both governorates.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provide life-saving shelter/NFI assistance and protection services to families displaced by conflict in Marib and Al Jawf

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provide life-saving shelter/NFI assistance and protection services to families displaced by conflict in Marib and Al Jawf

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 13,000 Enhanced Emergency Shelter Kits prepositioned and distributed in Marib and AlJawf to support the humanitarian response to families already displaced, or projected to be displaced in both governorates
# of Post Distribution Monitoring Surveys conducted
# of enhanced emergency shelter kits procured and prepositioned
# of households assisted with enhanced emergency shelter kits

19,600 Non-Food Items kits (NFI) are prepositioned or distributed in Marib and AlJawf to support the humanitarian response to families already displaced, or projected to be displaced in both governorates

6,000 HHs supported with cash subsidies in Marib help to pay their rent and avoid imminent eviction

Specific protection risks due to conflict and disasters are mitigated and addressed through the provision of quality and integrated protection and humanitarian services, to vulnerable displaced women, men, boys and girls including people with disabilities.
